pros:
Supportive administration, good staff
and Small town
cons:
Lack of capital
and Small town

pros: good place to work for the most part
cons: not a good 401k retirement program

pros: Equipment was new and up to date, and the facility is nice.
cons: Pay, Benefits, Culture, Cronyism, and Abusive Management

review_title: its okay but not long period job
pros: You get benefits and other departments are amazing
cons:
none 
None 
None 
None none

pros: Work at Broaddus Hospital, Philippi WV -- sister hospital to Davis Health System, Elkins, WV... small town critical access hospital with small town feel.
cons: Facility not governed or overseen by JACHO so it is off the guidelines set and adhered to by EVERYONE else... would rather pay travel staff double wages then pay their OWN employees what they are worth and are losing staff at an alarming rate... health insurance is awful, Davis is provided BCBS and Broaddus uses a "Benefit Assistance Corp" out of Huntinton that is very hard to deal with and unless you reside in this community and see dr's here, they will not pay (little if at all)

pros: The location of the hospital and growing size makes it a competitive work place for this area. They have fair wages and a nice benefit package. There is job security here as the organization is always expanding.
cons: Sometimes staff are treat as being expendable. And the insurance has a very high deductible. This makes it difficult for some to utilize their benefits. I

pros: Good benefits, most employees are friendly
cons: Poor pay, Lot of doctors have poor attitudes towards employess,

pros: Friendly staff, Helpful staff, some caring staff
cons: Workflow is terrible, census is low, employees are being forced to burn their PTO time due to no work.

review_title: Friendly working environment, but low pay
pros:
Co-workers were very nice, no inner office politics in my dept.
Great medical benefits
cons:
Low pay
Only met 1% of retirement

pros: Did not have any Pros for this
cons: It is a Hospital lots of death did not like that part.
